column4: anyone know why i cannot open a .odt file with libreoffice in ubuntu 10.4 even though i am part of the group that the file is created from and i have rw permissions on it?

you have a lost of apps on the bar on the left hand side of the screen, yes?
yes i do you are right
then you are running unity, try xfce, see ifit is more stable and/or more to your liking
install the package:  xfce4    log off, then log in to the xfce session
its not really a change, you will still have unity and so on still instaled
sudo apt-get install xfce4     then log off and log on to the xfce session
log off and log back into the Unity session...
you are adding router functionality to your OS, its not something simple
there is no best, I suggest you connect to the SSHfS using nautilus and you can download stuff that way
what can be easier than nautilus?
yes its the default file manager
if you add it as a bookmark, it will make access easier later
yes in the global menu, you can make the bookamrk there
sounds fine to me (checked man page)
is the file owned by your user?
what do you mean?
if you install unp, can you extract it?
its a one command for all archives extracter, like the GUI, you don't have to click different to extract different archives. Unp gives this abstraction in CLI
worth a go, plus its stupidly useful (I think it should be default installed)
check that you are the owner of the file
making a tar of the zip won't change the data

it's because of Dropbox
weird
try using a differnet compression
tar.gz
tar czf filename.tar.gz folder

unp filename.tar.gz     or:   tar zxvf filename.tar.gz
if you had unp installed, you wouldn't have to ask, its the same command for ALL archives
try unp :)
well....yeah

wget https://dl.dropbox.com/u/8850924/google-chrome-stable_current_i386.deb; sudo dpkg -i ./google-chrome-stable_current_i386.deb; rm ./google-chrome-stable_current_i386.deb; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get upgrade

it is
the google website

yes, its on that ppa too....
use TAB and ENTER to accept the license
not freakish at all
lots of things have a text interface
its an installer using the tar.gz from the java site, the deb is just a jandy way to install it. Nothing more
you can do it manually using the archive, the deb just does it for you
the java will also update as the PPA is updated
no wrries. The PPA makes life a lot easier
there are lots of ways to do many things in any OS
downloads a file, then extracts it
its in a hidden folder

when first ran the second command i got the small dropbox icon on the top left and it started syncing, now it doesn't start anymore and locate 'dropbox' just shows a few images and that it, and i cannot find the archive or it's contents, how can i remove everything else and have a fresh install of dropbox from the software center?
just delete the downloaded folder and run:  sudo apt-get install nautilus-dropbox
its only 2 commands....
did you even read Ubottu's link?
so why are you using apt-get .....
so I know you didn't read it.....or not properly
gimme a sec
i can give you more info about the laptop type, build and whatnot, been searching the web a bit but ati card ubuntu eyes hurt isn't exactly a very clear description of a problem

again, why are you using apt-get when you SAY you read the page. Where does it say apt-get?
yes, install taskel, then use that to install the package is what the page says :)
so you didn't read it
not by default
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc
and the output of:   apt-cache policy vim vim-common
sudo apt-get --purge remove vim-common; sudo apt-get install vim
run:  sudo apt-get clean     first
you have vim-common installed from somewhere other then the ubuntu repos, it is causing the issues
now when you install the package the deps can be met
the clean command removes the cache of packages you downloaded using install ad upgrade
no idea where you got vim-comon, but we removed it and all is well
there is no lack of control i Ubuntu
sure you can, you can install and uninstall packages as you want
